categories.description: The input will contain:       What type of lead generation project?       If you are a business, what is the size of your business?      What is the scope of this project?        When do you need this project completed by?       Any other details?

This will contain:    What type of resume?       What stage of resume writing are you in?      What are you in your career?         What industries are you focused on?    What are your goals in seeking a resume writer? Anything else the resume writer should know?

parameters.text:
=
Linkedin title of the person: 
Requirements/Project details: 


You are a professional resume writer named Mayank Agrawal.  You have the following base message template:

---
Hello,

I hope this message finds you well. I am excited to offer my services to enhance your resume. A well-crafted resume is essential for attracting recruiters, showcasing your skills, and standing out in today's competitive job market.

Why Choose My Services?

- Tailored Approach: I customize each resume to highlight your unique strengths, experiences, and career goals.
- Keyword Optimization: Leveraging industry-specific keywords ensures your profile ranks higher in search results.
- Professional Branding: Create a personal brand that resonates with your target audience.
- ATS-Friendly Formatting: I design resumes that pass through Applicant Tracking Systems (ATS) seamlessly.
- Add on Service: 100+ Customized leads (with LinkedIn Id and Email address), with an extra cost, based on your target persona, industry or company.

What You'll Get:
Customized Resume: A polished, one-page document that captures your achievements, skills, and qualifications.

Pricing and Timeline:
Let's discuss your specific needs and create a personalized proposal. Feel free to reach out via LinkedIn or email.

Thank you for considering my services. I look forward to helping you elevate your professional presence.

Best regards,  
Mayank Agrawal  
agrawalmayank26@gmail.com  
---

And here are the lead’s details:

- **Lead’s LinkedIn title**: {{ $('Edit Fields').item.json.output.title }} 
requirements given by lead:
{{ 
  $('Edit Fields').item.json.output.qa.map((item, index) => 
    `Q${index + 1}: ${item.question}\nA${index + 1}: ${item.answer}`
  ).join('\n\n') 
}} 

**Instruction**: Using only the content and services described in the base template above, generate a concise, friendly, personalized LinkedIn message that:

1. Opens by referencing their LinkedIn title and project need.  
2. Briefly highlights the four answers (type, stage, career status, industries) in a natural way.  
3. Retains the “Why Choose My Services?”, “What You’ll Get”, and “Pricing and Timeline” sections but weaves in one or two details from the lead’s answers.  
4. Closes with your signature.  

Do **not** add any new services or details beyond what’s in the template. Output just the final message text.

The Startup Adventure
Your journey to building a lovable company

Blame AI for tech layoffs?

Brian de Haaff
Read this article on LinkedIn to join the conversation
Read on LinkedIn

Dear adventurer,

I called it tech's "summer of pain."

This was back in 2022, when I wrote about the reductions in force, hiring freezes, rescinded offers, and even slashed bonuses that marked the turning point of the pandemic hiring boom.

By the end of the year, nearly 200,000 people would be laid off. Then, roughly 264,000 tech jobs lost in 2023 and 153,000 gone in 2024. We can expect more of the same this year — but something new seems to be at the center.

Why are we seeing so many layoffs in tech? Plenty of people would have you believe that AI is to blame.

That line of thinking makes for good and grabby news headlines. And there is some truth behind the AI blame game — a few companies have been open about how they are replacing workers with automation. For example, the parent company of Indeed and Glassdoor recently announced a 6% reduction in force, citing AI specifically.

You may have also seen where CEOs have publicly claimed that AI will replace at least half of knowledge workers in the U.S. alone. And you have seen others promote the idea that they are hiring autonomous coders (who all have the same name).

I think the connection between AI and layoffs is more subtle, albeit muddled in promise and fear. AI will replace certain types of work. (That does seem inevitable.)

And no leader wants to be late to make meaningful investments in new tech. The issue is that AI investments — especially at a large enterprise scale — are really expensive, and markets are stalled.

It is not so simple as 'AI is replacing people and taking all the tech jobs.' Companies do not want to be left behind, and the cost needs to be offset with savings from somewhere.

...
Keep reading on LinkedIn
This email was intended for Mayank Agrawal (IESEG, Paris | HPAIR AFCON'24 | Ex ATGL | GL G'25 | VIT V'20)

The Startup Adventure

By Brian de Haaff


By Brian de Haaff

    
    
    Read this article on LinkedIn to join the conversation
Read on LinkedIn
https://www.linkedin.com/comm/pulse/blame-ai-tech-layoffs-brian-de-haaff-0t4xf?lipi=urn%3Ali%3Apage%3Aemail_email_series_follow_newsletter_01%3BlXBmm%2FuXQ3WuGOXzuorMyw%3D%3D&midToken=AQEL2poUgT6org&midSig=0RJ3CAvq690XU1&trk=eml-email_series_follow_newsletter_01-null-0-read_more_banner_cta_&trkEmail=eml-email_series_follow_newsletter_01-null-0-read_more_banner_cta_-null-9atbpc~mdolumyi~5p-null-null&eid=9atbpc-mdolumyi-5p&otpToken=MTcwMzFjZTMxNzI3YzBjN2IyMjQwNGVkNDMxZGUwYmQ4OGM5ZDE0OTk5YTY4YzYxNzVjMTA2NmI0ZTVhNTRmN2YzZDNkZjk2MTBjYmI4ODQ3OWFjZTJmNmJmMWU0MThmYjU4NTU3Y2I0YTc0YzZiMzIyODk1YSwxLDE%3D
  
Dear adventurer, I called it tech's "summer of pain." This was back in 2022, when I wrote about the reductions in force, hiring freezes, rescinded offers, and even slashed bonuses that marked the turning point of the pandemic hiring boom. By the end of the year, nearly 200,000 people would be laid off. Then, roughly 264,000 tech jobs lost in 2023 and 153,000 gone in 2024. We can expect more of the same this year — but something new seems to be at the center. Why are we seeing so many layoffs in tech? Plenty of people would have you believe that AI is to blame. That line of thinking makes for good and grabby news headlines. And there is some truth behind the AI blame game — a few companies have been open about how they are replacing workers with automation. For example, the parent company of Indeed and Glassdoor recently announced a 6% reduction in force, citing AI specifically. You may have also seen where CEOs have publicly claimed that AI will replace at least half of knowledge workers in the U.S. alone. And you have seen others promote the idea that they are hiring autonomous coders (who all have the same name). I think the connection between AI and layoffs is more subtle, albeit muddled in promise and fear. AI will replace certain types of work. (That does seem inevitable.) And no leader wants to be late to make meaningful investments in new tech. The issue is that AI investments — especially at a large enterprise scale — are really expensive, and markets are stalled. It is not so simple as 'AI is replacing people and taking all the tech jobs.' Companies do not want to be left behind, and the cost needs to be offset with savings from somewhere. At Aha! we have been doing many demos of our transformative new AI assistant, which just launched publicly this past week. In every conversation, it has been clear that executives (many at the world's largest companies) are eager to advance AI initiatives to improve performance and keep pace with innovation. Most are still hazy on exactly what that means, though. The one thing they do know is there is no time to dawdle. So, they are running internal pilots in often random directions and trying to show some value in real time. This presents challenges for the organization and is where some of the AI fear lurks. Layoffs are being driven by larger market forces. But you do not want to stand by and watch as the promise of automation consumes your work, either. Here are my suggestions for product builders dealing with the promise and fear of AI: Embrace the ambiguity You are uniquely positioned to tolerate uncertainty. Yes, AI is evolving and impacting our work at breakneck speed, and the not knowing can create anxiety. But the best product builders thrive in ambiguous environments and welcome the unknown. Instead of wallowing in fear, embrace this as a chance to experiment, learn, and adapt. Advocate for it You have an opportunity to help shape how AI integrates into product development at your company. Do not sit idly and wait to be left behind. This is not about replacing human creativity or judgment — it is about using AI to amplify capabilities and focus on activities that will deliver the most value. Position yourself as the champion of AI augmentation within your organization, and look for ways to bring it into your work instead of guarding yourself from it. Use it You do not need to overhaul your entire product development discipline overnight. But you do need hands-on experience to become more confident and understand what is possible. Think about how you could leverage AI to accelerate time to market, improve decision-making, or free up the team to focus on strategic initiatives rather than tactical execution. Look at this as a net gain: AI is a collaborative partner that can help you focus on what truly matters. Share successes and failures You have to be honest about the benefits and limitations. Track how AI materially impacts the work: time savings, improved decisions, or new insights. Concrete metrics can help you demonstrate the importance of AI augmentation rather than outright replacement. But be honest about the limitations, too. AI will fall short in some areas where human thinking will prevail. A balanced perspective will help steady expectations and shape go-forward initiatives. Remember that new technology grows markets — it has never been a zero-sum game. This may be hard to see right now because the last few years have been so taxing. It is understandable that many folks are rattled by both the promise and the fear of what AI will mean for them personally and professionally at this moment. Unfortunately, economic realities in the short term will likely mean a continued drumbeat of layoff announcements. But that will likely change, as it always has. My recommendation is to take a broad view. See AI as a way that you can not only be more effective in your current role, but also as a way you can position yourself as a forward-thinking leader in integrating AI into your organization. And whatever happens, know that a layoff is not a reflection of your skill or worth. What I have experienced over my own 25-year career in tech suggests that we will also see an emergence of new possibilities and the creation of value that is unimaginable as of now. AI can get us there faster — but human insight, empathy, and strategic thinking will remain irreplaceable. Keep seeking, Brian
Keep reading on LinkedIn

Keeping this in mind, we have designed this dedicated career building knowledge platform for…

Explore Graduates Jobs Opportunities at Amdocs for Career Growth

Career For Freshers
Read this article on LinkedIn to join the conversation
Read on LinkedIn

Amdocs helps those who build the future to make it amazing. With our market-leading portfolio of software products and services, we unlock our customers’ innovative potential, empowering them to provide next-generation communication and media experiences for both the individual end user and enterprise customers.

Careers at Amdocs, Amdocs Careers for Graduate Entry Level Fresher role

Our 30,000 employees around the globe are here to accelerate service providers’ migration to the cloud, enable them to differentiate in the 5G era, and digitalize and automate their operations. Listed on the NASDAQ Global Select Market, Amdocs had revenue of $4.3 billion in fiscal 2021.

At Amdocs, your future isn’t just a job—it’s a launchpad. You’ll work on innovative technologies, gain real-world experience, and learn from some of the brightest minds in the industry. This is your opportunity to grow, connect, and make a real impact—starting from day one.

Amdocs Careers for Fresher & Entry Level In 2025

Treasury Analyst (Entry-Level)

We are seeking a motivated and analytical graduate to join our Treasury team. In this role, you will support tasks relating to the company’s liquidity, funding, and Treasury Operations while gaining hands-on experience in cash flow forecasting, and financial analysis.

Bachelor’s degree in Finance, Economics, Accounting, Mathematics, or a related discipline Recent graduate or up to 1 year experience in a Treasury of Finance related role Excellent Knowledge of Excel Personal drive with a curious mindset as well as a good work ethic, with an eagerness to learn Excellent English verbal and written communication skills.

Amdocs helps those who build the future to make it amazing. With our market-leading portfolio of software products and services, we unlock our customers’ innovative potential, empowering them to provide next-generation communication and media experiences for both the individual end user and enterprise customers. Careers at Amdocs, Amdocs Careers for Graduate Entry Level Fresher role Our 30,000 employees around the globe are here to accelerate service providers’ migration to the cloud, enable them to differentiate in the 5G era, and digitalize and automate their operations. Listed on the NASDAQ Global Select Market, Amdocs had revenue of $4.3 billion in fiscal 2021. At Amdocs, your future isn’t just a job—it’s a launchpad. You’ll work on innovative technologies, gain real-world experience, and learn from some of the brightest minds in the industry. This is your opportunity to grow, connect, and make a real impact—starting from day one. Amdocs Careers for Fresher & Entry Level In 2025 Treasury Analyst (Entry-Level) We are seeking a motivated and analytical graduate to join our Treasury team. In this role, you will support tasks relating to the company’s liquidity, funding, and Treasury Operations while gaining hands-on experience in cash flow forecasting, and financial analysis. Bachelor’s degree in Finance, Economics, Accounting, Mathematics, or a related discipline Recent graduate or up to 1 year experience in a Treasury of Finance related role Excellent Knowledge of Excel Personal drive with a curious mindset as well as a good work ethic, with an eagerness to learn Excellent English verbal and written communication skills. Invoicing Specialist – AI & Automation Focus (Entry-Level) As an Invoicing Specialist, you will be responsible for gathering transactional data, processing customer billing, and leading cash collection efforts—while exploring opportunities to enhance these processes through AI and automation. Software Engineer-Cobol,JCL,DB2/IMS (2-6 Yrs) – India  Fiber Engineer (Autocad AND TCP Permit OR Layout design) – India Join our fiber engineering team to drive permit planning and layout design for high-impact OSP projects while ensuring seamless coordination with cross-functional teams and local authorities. Marketing Associate – Intern – Philippines For more details information to apply Amdocs Graduate Careers, Click here!

moneycontrol.com

One quick thing: Deepinder Goyal's net worth surges by Rs 1,700 crore as Eternal shares rise 20% in two days

In today’s newsletter:

  • Paytm swings back to profit
  • Milky Mist's DRHP decoded
  • Infosys' new council for frontier tech

P.S.: Introducing the Tech3 Podcast, your daily dose of tech and startup insights. Monday to Friday! Check it out on Spotify or Apple Podcasts

Paytm swings back to profit

A quiet profit, at last...no family silver sold, no ESOP firework. Just margins behaving 

Driving the news: One97 Communications, the parent of Paytm, reported a Rs 123 crore net profit in Q1 FY26, a clean reversal from a Rs 839 crore loss a year ago.

  • Revenue rose 28% YoY to Rs 1,918 crore, driven by lending growth and stable payment revenues; contribution margin expanded from 50% to 60%

  • EBITDA turned positive at Rs 72 crore versus a loss last quarter, helped by lower marketing and employee costs, including a sharp drop in ESOP charges

This marks Paytm’s first profit driven by core operations since its 2021 listing — unlike the September 2024 quarter when a Rs 1,345 crore one-time gain from its Zomato ticketing deal led to temporary profitability.

  • After regulatory chokeholds, a collapsed payments bank, and muted loan disbursals, the company seems to have stabilised on the back of merchant loans, non-DLG lending, and extreme cost discipline

Merchant loan powers rebound: Financial services revenue doubled YoY to Rs 561 crore, driven by non-DLG merchant loans and better collections.

  • Over 5.6 lakh users took loans, insurance or broking services via Paytm this quarter

...

One quick thing: Deepinder Goyal's net worth surges by Rs 1,700 crore as Eternal shares rise 20% in two days In today’s newsletter: Paytm swings back to profit Milky Mist's DRHP decoded Infosys' new council for frontier tech P.S.: Introducing the Tech3 Podcast, your daily dose of tech and startup insights. Monday to Friday! Check it out on Spotify or Apple Podcasts Paytm swings back to profit A quiet profit, at last...no family silver sold, no ESOP firework. Just margins behaving  Driving the news: One97 Communications, the parent of Paytm, reported a Rs 123 crore net profit in Q1 FY26, a clean reversal from a Rs 839 crore loss a year ago. Revenue rose 28% YoY to Rs 1,918 crore, driven by lending growth and stable payment revenues; contribution margin expanded from 50% to 60% EBITDA turned positive at Rs 72 crore versus a loss last quarter, helped by lower marketing and employee costs, including a sharp drop in ESOP charges This marks Paytm’s first profit driven by core operations since its 2021 listing — unlike the September 2024 quarter when a Rs 1,345 crore one-time gain from its Zomato ticketing deal led to temporary profitability. After regulatory chokeholds, a collapsed payments bank, and muted loan disbursals, the company seems to have stabilised on the back of merchant loans, non-DLG lending, and extreme cost discipline Merchant loan powers rebound: Financial services revenue doubled YoY to Rs 561 crore, driven by non-DLG merchant loans and better collections. Over 5.6 lakh users took loans, insurance or broking services via Paytm this quarter Personal loan disbursals stayed soft, but repeat merchant borrowers now account for over 50% of disbursals — a sign of stickiness Holding ground: Paytm’s payment revenue rose 38% YoY to Rs 529 crore supported by better processing economics and steady merchant device additions; sequential growth was flat. Merchant devices hit 1.3 crore, with lower capex due to refurbished redeployments Paytm’s AI-led automation helped cut indirect costs by 19% YoY, with non-sales employee costs falling 36%. Editor's Picks
Moneycontrol cuts through the clutter and brings you the best of our exclusive stories…

Apple’s AirPods hurdle in India, India’s highest paid CEOs and Saiyaraa’s Rs 100 crore in 4 days -- Editor’s Picks from…

moneycontrol.com
Read this article on LinkedIn to join the conversation
Read on LinkedIn

Dear reader,

Apple’s plan to manufacture AirPods in India has hit a hurdle, with China’s curbs on rare earth materials exports disrupting the supply of critical components to Foxconn’s Telangana facility. Danish Khan reports that if the issue persists, it could undermine the competitiveness of the India plant and shift advantage to rival suppliers Luxshare and Goertek’s factories in Vietnam, they said.

Which Indian CEOs take home the highest salaries? Among the 26 companies that have disclosed executive compensation so far this quarter, two familiar names top the charts in CEO compensation. Pawan Munjal of Hero MotoCorp and Rajeev Jain of Bajaj Finance took home more than Rs 100 crore each in FY25. Other top earners include SN Subrahmanyan of Larsen & Toubro, who earned Rs 60.37 crore, and Mohit Joshi of Tech Mahindra, who pocketed Rs 53.90 crore in his first year. Keep in mind, of course, that a significant share of CEO packages is based on performance-linked incentives and multi-year stock options, with fixed salaries accounting for a smaller portion.

The capital markets regulator SEBI is planning to open new doors for investment managers. SEBI’s board may classify REITs and InvITs as equity in its next board meeting, enhancing their acceptability and enabling mutual funds to include them in equity schemes, write Priyansh Verma and Brajesh Kumar. The finance ministry has conveyed its support for the reclassification, which could attract more investments into these instruments and help drive growth in the real estate and infrastructure sectors. Additionally, SEBI may increase the investment limits for mutual funds in REITs and InvITs from 10 percent to 20 percent of the scheme’s net value.

Dear reader, Apple’s plan to manufacture AirPods in India has hit a hurdle, with China’s curbs on rare earth materials exports disrupting the supply of critical components to Foxconn’s Telangana facility. Danish Khan reports that if the issue persists, it could undermine the competitiveness of the India plant and shift advantage to rival suppliers Luxshare and Goertek’s factories in Vietnam, they said. Which Indian CEOs take home the highest salaries? Among the 26 companies that have disclosed executive compensation so far this quarter, two familiar names top the charts in CEO compensation. Pawan Munjal of Hero MotoCorp and Rajeev Jain of Bajaj Finance took home more than Rs 100 crore each in FY25. Other top earners include SN Subrahmanyan of Larsen & Toubro, who earned Rs 60.37 crore, and Mohit Joshi of Tech Mahindra, who pocketed Rs 53.90 crore in his first year. Keep in mind, of course, that a significant share of CEO packages is based on performance-linked incentives and multi-year stock options, with fixed salaries accounting for a smaller portion. The capital markets regulator SEBI is planning to open new doors for investment managers. SEBI’s board may classify REITs and InvITs as equity in its next board meeting, enhancing their acceptability and enabling mutual funds to include them in equity schemes, write Priyansh Verma and Brajesh Kumar. The finance ministry has conveyed its support for the reclassification, which could attract more investments into these instruments and help drive growth in the real estate and infrastructure sectors. Additionally, SEBI may increase the investment limits for mutual funds in REITs and InvITs from 10 percent to 20 percent of the scheme’s net value. After SEBI’s order against Jane Street over alleged fraudulent trading practices, the algo trader has assembled a high-powered legal defence. Ashish Rukhaiyar reports that Jane Street has hired two Indian law firms - AZB & Partners and Khaitan & Co. - along with foreign law firm Sullivan & Cromwell LLP, to address legal issues arising from SEBI’s order, SEBI barred Jane Street from trading in the Indian securities market, alleging fraudulent and unfair trade practices, and directed the firm to deposit Rs 4,844 crore. SEBI has since conditionally allowed Jane Street to resume trading. A parliamentary panel headed by BJP’s Baijayant Panda has suggested several amendments to the Income Tax Bill. In an exclusive interview with Shweta Punj, Panda explains why he thinks the new Bill can be simplified, what it means for individuals and corporates and how it may reduce litigation. Also read Preeti Kulkarni’s piece on five takeaways for individual tax payers from the house panel’s report - including on tax refunds and house property income. With Vice President Jagdeep Dhankar’s sudden resignation creating an unexpected constitutional crisis, check out Parimal Peeyush’s piece on the multiple theories doing the rounds on the timing of his exit. The VP’s resignation in a huff has added to the stormy tones of Parliament’s monsoon session with both houses functioning only briefly on Day 1. But a turbulent start has become the norm, writes Ishaan Gera in our data story of the day. Average productivity in the Lok Sabha during Monsoon Sessions dropped sharply to 51.5 percent between 2021 and 2024 - compared to 91.8 percent during 2015–2019, as per a special  Moneycontrol analysis. The Rajya Sabha, however,  saw a marginal improvement. The government’s Scheme to Promote Manufacturing of Electric Passenger Cars has received zero applications despite the portal opening on June 24. Foreign EV makers cited concerns over local value addition mandate of 25 percent over three years and the lack of consideration for past investments, reports Adrija Chatterjee. Also read Preeti Kulkarni’s piece on how Tesla’s India debut has prompted some insurers to focus on EV-specific motor insurance covers. India’s net household savings have plummeted to 5.3 percent of GDP in 2023, the lowest in nearly 50 years, as people increasingly rely on credit and spend on lifestyle upgrades. Do read Balwant Singh Mehta and Devendra Kumar’s take on the generational shift that is changing India’s savings culture. And finally, with Saiyaara’s surprise success breathing new life into Indian theatres, read Maryam Farooqui’s piece on how Saiyaara has raked in Rs 100 crore in just four days. Also, check out this piece by Sarika Sharma to understand why the romantic drama starring Aneet Padda and Ahaan Panday, is winning young hearts, especially in tier-2 and tier 3 India. Read this along with Moneycontrol’s listing of how Saiyaara is the second fastest film in 2025 to reach Rs 100 crore on the box office after Chhava - which took three days to reach the milestone. Regards, Nalin Mehta Managing Editor Moneycontrol If you'd like Editor's Picks delivered straight to your inbox, subscribe now! Deloitte Virtual Recruitment Drive | (In-Person Interview)

Career For Freshers
Read this article on LinkedIn to join the conversation
Read on LinkedIn

Deloitte Touche Tohmatsu Limited commonly referred to as Deloitte, is a British multinational professional services network headquartered in London, England. Deloitte is the largest professional services network by revenue and number of professionals in the world and is considered one of the Big Four accounting firms along with EY, KPMG and PwC.

Deloitte Virtual Interview 2025, Deloitte Virtual Drive for Graduate Entry Level and Experience Professionals candidates in various domain in PAN India Locations

If you would like to be in a role where you can leverage your strengths supporting Deloitte’s flagship clients, this could be the role for you. The role provides you opportunities to get involved in a wide variety of activities in delivering best in class account management support to account leadership. As part of this team, you’ll gain exposure to a variety of projects those challenge and enrich you, and to a lot of opportunities to collaborate with and learn from some of the most talented professionals, all of which would help in your professional growth and skills development.

Deloitte Virtual Recruitment Drive on 26th July 2025

Join Our Cyber Star Team -Deloitte India !!

Cyber Champs-Are you ready to apply your knowledge & background to exciting new challenges ? From Learning to Leadership, this is your chance to take your career to next level.

Time2MeetTheTeam @Deloitte-Thane(Mumbai)Office -26th July (Saturday)

Interested Applicants-Choose your Impact & Apply on the below links ::

Deloitte Touche Tohmatsu Limited commonly referred to as Deloitte, is a British multinational professional services network headquartered in London, England. Deloitte is the largest professional services network by revenue and number of professionals in the world and is considered one of the Big Four accounting firms along with EY, KPMG and PwC. Deloitte Virtual Interview 2025, Deloitte Virtual Drive for Graduate Entry Level and Experience Professionals candidates in various domain in PAN India Locations If you would like to be in a role where you can leverage your strengths supporting Deloitte’s flagship clients, this could be the role for you. The role provides you opportunities to get involved in a wide variety of activities in delivering best in class account management support to account leadership. As part of this team, you’ll gain exposure to a variety of projects those challenge and enrich you, and to a lot of opportunities to collaborate with and learn from some of the most talented professionals, all of which would help in your professional growth and skills development. Erekrut... Recruitment Made Easy
Read this article on LinkedIn to join the conversation

Welcome to Erekrut's Daily Job Alert! Love crafting dream itineraries and curating bespoke global journeys? Here’s your boarding pass to a fantastic career in travel consulting!

Job Opportunity of the Day

Position: Senior Travel Consultant

Company: Tripology Holidays Pvt. Ltd.

Location: Ahmedabad, Gujarat

Salary: Confidential

Experience: 4–6 Years

Apply Now: Apply Now

Responsibilities:

  • Design and develop personalized travel itineraries for clients traveling to long haul destinations (Europe, Australia-New Zealand, South Africa, Turkey, USA, Canada & more), exceeding their expectations and ensuring a seamless experience.
  • Conduct thorough research on destinations, including attractions, accommodations, transportation options, cultural nuances, and visa requirements (basic knowledge of Schengen VISA a plus).
  • Utilize online travel booking engines to secure competitive rates for flights, hotels, tours, and other travel components.
  • Design and develop personalized travel itineraries for clients traveling to Europe, exceeding their expectations and ensuring a seamless experience.
  • Conduct thorough research on destinations, including attractions, accommodations, transportation options, cultural nuances, and visa requirements (basic knowledge of Schengen VISA a plus).
  • Utilize online travel booking engines (OTBs) to secure competitive rates for flights, hotels, tours, and other travel components.
  • Manage all aspects of travel arrangements, including booking flights, hotels, car rentals, and activities.
  • Build strong relationships with clients, actively listening to their needs and preferences to create bespoke itineraries that align with their budget and travel style.

Welcome to Erekrut's Daily Job Alert! Love crafting dream itineraries and curating bespoke global journeys? Here’s your boarding pass to a fantastic career in travel consulting! Job Opportunity of the Day Position: Senior Travel Consultant Company: Tripology Holidays Pvt. Ltd. Location: Ahmedabad, Gujarat Salary: Confidential Experience: 4–6 Years Apply Now: Apply Now Responsibilities: Design and develop personalized travel itineraries for clients traveling to long haul destinations (Europe, Australia-New Zealand, South Africa, Turkey, USA, Canada & more), exceeding their expectations and ensuring a seamless experience. Conduct thorough research on destinations, including attractions, accommodations, transportation options, cultural nuances, and visa requirements (basic knowledge of Schengen VISA a plus). Utilize online travel booking engines to secure competitive rates for flights, hotels, tours, and other travel components. Design and develop personalized travel itineraries for clients traveling to Europe, exceeding their expectations and ensuring a seamless experience. Conduct thorough research on destinations, including attractions, accommodations, transportation options, cultural nuances, and visa requirements (basic knowledge of Schengen VISA a plus). Utilize online travel booking engines (OTBs) to secure competitive rates for flights, hotels, tours, and other travel components. Manage all aspects of travel arrangements, including booking flights, hotels, car rentals, and activities. Build strong relationships with clients, actively listening to their needs and preferences to create bespoke itineraries that align with their budget and travel style. Provide accurate and up-to-date information on destinations, cultural insights, and travel logistics. Proactively monitor and manage changes in travel restrictions, advisories, and flight schedules. Maintain strong working relationships with travel suppliers and tourism boards. Contribute to the team by sharing knowledge and expertise with colleagues. Stay current on industry trends and developments related to European travel. Participate in ongoing training and professional development opportunities. Educational Qualifications: Minimum 3-5 years of experience as a travel consultant with a proven track record of creating successful travel packages, particularly for European destinations. Extensive knowledge of European geography, cultures, and popular tourist attractions. Ability to create customized itineraries that cater to diverse client interests and budgets. Proficiency in using online travel booking engines (OTBs) and travel management software. Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with a focus on active listening, building rapport, and exceeding client expectations. Strong attention to detail and organizational skills. Ability to work independently and as part of a team. Fluency in English communication is essential. Boost Your Profile – Get Noticed by Recruiters Pro Plan – ₹300/month (Excl. GST) 20 recruiter connects (chat and email) Video resume option SMS and Email job alerts Work preference visibility Premium Plan– ₹500/month (Excl. GST) All Pro features 60 recruiter connects Enhanced visibility for faster hiring Login & Subscribe: https://www.erekrut.com/candidate-plan/ Career Tip of the Day “The world is a book and those who do not travel read only one page.” – Saint Augustine

By Erekrut... Recruitment Made Easy

https://www.linkedin.com/comm/pulse/job-opportunity-senior-travel-consultant-erekrut-iikcc?lipi=urn%3Ali%3Apage%3Aemail_email_series_follow_newsletter_01%3Bh0VEewxRTwSeZ9bdvbekSA%3D%3D&midToken=AQEL2poUgT6org&midSig=0amjSW8ECp0HU1&trk=eml-email_series_follow_newsletter_01-null-0-read_more_banner_cta_&trkEmail=eml-email_series_follow_newsletter_01-null-0-read_more_banner_cta_-null-9atbpc~mdod9zmw~du-null-null&eid=9atbpc-mdod9zmw-du&otpToken=MTcwMzFjZTMxNzI3YzBjN2IyMjQwNGVkNDMxZGUwYmM4Y2NjZDk0Njk4YWI4YzYxNzVjMTA2NmI0ZTVhNTRmN2YzZDNkZjk4NzZiMGY5ODAwMjg0YTIzYmRjMWZlZTBiYTVjY2VkMjNhNzU1MTZkMGQ4OGE4NSwxLDE%3D

Welcome to Erekrut's Daily Job Alert! Love crafting dream itineraries and curating bespoke global journeys? Here’s your boarding pass to a fantastic career in travel consulting! Job Opportunity of the Day Position: Senior Travel Consultant Company: Tripology Holidays Pvt. Ltd. Location: Ahmedabad, Gujarat Salary: Confidential Experience: 4–6 Years Apply Now: Apply Now Responsibilities: Design and develop personalized travel itineraries for clients traveling to long haul destinations (Europe, Australia-New Zealand, South Africa, Turkey, USA, Canada & more), exceeding their expectations and ensuring a seamless experience. Conduct thorough research on destinations, including attractions, accommodations, transportation options, cultural nuances, and visa requirements (basic knowledge of Schengen VISA a plus). Utilize online travel booking engines to secure competitive rates for flights, hotels, tours, and other travel components. Design and develop personalized travel itineraries for clients traveling to Europe, exceeding their expectations and ensuring a seamless experience. Conduct thorough research on destinations, including attractions, accommodations, transportation options, cultural nuances, and visa requirements (basic knowledge of Schengen VISA a plus). Utilize online travel booking engines (OTBs) to secure competitive rates for flights, hotels, tours, and other travel components. Manage all aspects of travel arrangements, including booking flights, hotels, car rentals, and activities. Build strong relationships with clients, actively listening to their needs and preferences to create bespoke itineraries that align with their budget and travel style. Provide accurate and up-to-date information on destinations, cultural insights, and travel logistics. Proactively monitor and manage changes in travel restrictions, advisories, and flight schedules. Maintain strong working relationships with travel suppliers and tourism boards. Contribute to the team by sharing knowledge and expertise with colleagues. Stay current on industry trends and developments related to European travel. Participate in ongoing training and professional development opportunities. Educational Qualifications: Minimum 3-5 years of experience as a travel consultant with a proven track record of creating successful travel packages, particularly for European destinations. Extensive knowledge of European geography, cultures, and popular tourist attractions. Ability to create customized itineraries that cater to diverse client interests and budgets. Proficiency in using online travel booking engines (OTBs) and travel management software. Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with a focus on active listening, building rapport, and exceeding client expectations. Strong attention to detail and organizational skills. Ability to work independently and as part of a team. Fluency in English communication is essential. Boost Your Profile – Get Noticed by Recruiters Pro Plan – ₹300/month (Excl. GST) 20 recruiter connects (chat and email) Video resume option SMS and Email job alerts Work preference visibility Premium Plan– ₹500/month (Excl. GST) All Pro features 60 recruiter connects Enhanced visibility for faster hiring Login & Subscribe: https://www.erekrut.com/candidate-plan/ Career Tip of the Day “The world is a book and those who do not travel read only one page.” – Saint Augustine

Craftmanship Chronicles
Every month we'll take you behind-the-scenes of manufacturing and engineering to discover a world…

How conquering the Everest of Motorsport will help craft the Defender of tomorrow

JLR
Read this article on LinkedIn to join the conversation
Read on LinkedIn

Next year, Defender will embrace the impossible and head for the most extreme off-road challenge on Earth: the Dakar Rally in Saudi Arabia.

Often called the Everest of Motorsport, Dakar is renowned as the toughest off-road motorsport event in the world.

Defender will compete in the new ‘Stock’ category of the FIA World Rally-Raid Championship with Dakar, the Championship’s halo event, presenting the ultimate test bed. A place to unlock real-world engineering insights, push platform durability and test performance under pressure, to help shape future Defender development.

Why Dakar?

Founded in 1979, the Dakar Rally was originally called the Paris to Dakar Rally as it  finished in Dakar, Senegal. Since then, the Rally has evolved and in 2026, the Dakar Rally will be held entirely in Saudi Arabia, looping around and back to the shores of the Red Sea, taking in vast unyielding landscapes.

Over two tough weeks, drivers navigate more than 8,000km of wild terrain - towering dunes, jagged rocks, and unpredictable surfaces - all whilst facing temperatures ranging from -5°C at night, to over 40°C during the day.

And then there’s the time. Twelve stages across 13 days, including one gruelling 48-hour leg where drivers must camp out in the wilderness.

“There’s no substitute for the kind of learning you get in an environment like Dakar. Every kilometre helps us push Defender further. Every upgrade we make is shaped by real-world pressure, creating insights that feed into our understanding of vehicle capability and durability.”

...
Keep reading on LinkedIn

Craftmanship Chronicles

By JLR


By JLR

    
    
    Read this article on LinkedIn to join the conversation
Read on LinkedIn
https://www.linkedin.com/comm/pulse/how-conquering-everest-motorsport-help-craft-defender-92mge?lipi=urn%3Ali%3Apage%3Aemail_email_series_follow_newsletter_01%3Bp%2BeeevICRmCsP%2BUytnLxUA%3D%3D&midToken=AQEL2poUgT6org&midSig=0amjSW8ECp0HU1&trk=eml-email_series_follow_newsletter_01-null-0-read_more_banner_cta_&trkEmail=eml-email_series_follow_newsletter_01-null-0-read_more_banner_cta_-null-9atbpc~mdod9zmx~f0-null-null&eid=9atbpc-mdod9zmx-f0&otpToken=MTcwMzFjZTMxNzI3YzBjN2IyMjQwNGVkNDMxZGUwYmM4Y2NjZDk0NjlhYTc4YzYxNzVjMTA2NmI0ZTVhNTRmN2YzZDNkZmE3MWJlMmU2YzY3OGYyYWMzZjE4ODVjYzU0YjMyNmU3NDFiNGYwYWU4MzAwMTVlMCwxLDE%3D
  
Next year, Defender will embrace the impossible and head for the most extreme off-road challenge on Earth: the Dakar Rally in Saudi Arabia. Often called the Everest of Motorsport, Dakar is renowned as the toughest off-road motorsport event in the world. Defender will compete in the new ‘Stock’ category of the FIA World Rally-Raid Championship with Dakar, the Championship’s halo event, presenting the ultimate test bed. A place to unlock real-world engineering insights, push platform durability and test performance under pressure, to help shape future Defender development. Why Dakar? Founded in 1979, the Dakar Rally was originally called the Paris to Dakar Rally as it  finished in Dakar, Senegal. Since then, the Rally has evolved and in 2026, the Dakar Rally will be held entirely in Saudi Arabia, looping around and back to the shores of the Red Sea, taking in vast unyielding landscapes. Over two tough weeks, drivers navigate more than 8,000km of wild terrain - towering dunes, jagged rocks, and unpredictable surfaces - all whilst facing temperatures ranging from -5°C at night, to over 40°C during the day. And then there’s the time. Twelve stages across 13 days, including one gruelling 48-hour leg where drivers must camp out in the wilderness. “There’s no substitute for the kind of learning you get in an environment like Dakar. Every kilometre helps us push Defender further. Every upgrade we make is shaped by real-world pressure, creating insights that feed into our understanding of vehicle capability and durability.” Jack Lambert, Head of Technical Integration, JLR Motorsport. Prototype. Progress. Purpose. To conquer Dakar, we’ll be competing with the Defender Dakar D7X-R. This isn’t a bespoke rally car built from scratch but one based on the production Defender 110. It’s built on the same fundamental D7x architecture used by all Defenders, including the extreme performance Defender OCTA, the most advanced and capable Defender ever made. Think of the architecture as the car’s foundation, underpinning every other part of the vehicle. The D7x architecture is engineered to give the Defender its characteristic durability and capability, providing an incredibly strong base to mount the suspension, powertrain and body on. All of this allows Defender to be truly unstoppable when tackling rugged terrain. With the D7x architecture, we’re getting strength that won’t bend under pressure, advanced suspension for smooth control on rough terrain, and a responsive powertrain. It’s the best combination for delivering luxury characteristics on the road, while also withstanding high intensity off-roading. By building our rally car on this foundation, we’re starting with something already proven, engineered to the highest bar and pushing it even further; to learn everything we can to evolve our vehicles. "Defender has always been about engineering with intent - robust, capable, and uncompromising. Craftsmanship isn’t just about materials; it’s about how things are engineered to endure. What makes today’s Defender so formidable - its durability, composure and engineering integrity is exactly what gives us the confidence to take it to Dakar." Hugo Mazzoleni, Chassis Manager, JLR. Ahead of the race next year, we’re testing our prototypes, teaching us more about how we maximise the capability and durability of Defender when we race.   To give you an early  glimpse into our latest Defender Dakar D7X-R prototype, some of the features include: Competition rally dampers combined with 17-inch bespoke wheels with 35-inch tyres, designed to absorb punishment and grip shifting surfaces. Increased track width brings greater balance and control. It’s the difference between standing with your feet together or shoulder-width apart on uneven ground - more stability. An increased ride height which makes it easier to drive over rocks, ruts, or deep sand without scraping the bottom or getting stuck. A motorsport-grade steering rack, connecting the steering wheel to the wheels, and enabling faster inputs and improved stability over impacts - crucial in rally racing where consistency and robustness matter. The standard exhaust has been replaced with a shorter, more open system for optimal gas flow and less heat buildup for maximum performance - even in 40°C desert heat. Finally, an exceptional vehicle requires exceptional drivers, so we’ve brought together a stellar driver line-up to lead the way; Dakar legend Stéphane Peterhansel, rising star Rokas Baciuška, and US off-road champion, Sara Price. This is just the beginning With only seven months to go until Dakar 2026, everything we’re learning from preparing for the world’s toughest race is feeding into the next evolution of Defender. It’s a chance to put our capability to the test, combining luxury with endurance to  bring our clients the kind of confidence only Defender can deliver.
Keep reading on LinkedIn

S&P Global Daily Update
A daily, curated selection of essential intelligence on financial markets and the global economy…

Daily Update: Indices for the Energy Transition; GenAI Investment Surge; and Beef Prices Rise Amid Tariffs

S&P Global
Read this article on LinkedIn to join the conversation
Read on LinkedIn

Today is Tuesday, July 22, 2025, and here’s your curated selection of Essential Intelligence on global markets from S&P Global. Subscribe to be notified of each new Daily Update.

Energy Transition & Sustainability

Understanding Energy Transition and Sustainability Reporting

How are indices and data-driven insights helping market participants navigate the energy transition? S&P Dow Jones Indices’ Maya Beyhan and S&P Global Sustainable1’s Patil Mesrobian joined the CFA Institute’s Jeanette Tawk to examine the expanding toolkit for assessing energy transition risks and opportunities.

View media

Artificial Intelligence

Listen: How Long the GenAI Investment Surge Will Last

S&P Global Market Intelligence reporter Iuri Struta joined the “MediaTalk” podcast with host Mike Reynolds to discuss the impact of generative AI on various sectors and the investment trends driving its growth.

Over $78 billion was invested in GenAI companies in the first half, a figure that nears $100 billion when third-quarter investments are included. Major players such as OpenAI and Meta are leading the charge, but a range of startups are also making waves in the application layer.

View media

Global Trade

US, Australian beef prices rise amid tariff concerns for Brazilian imports

US President Donald Trump’s announcement of a 50% tariff on all beef imports from Brazil has led to increased prices for 90CL lean beef trim in the US and Australia. This new tariff, effective Aug. 1, adds to the 36.4% tariff already imposed on Brazilian beef, which previously faced a 26.4% tariff before an additional 10% tariff was implemented. The escalating tariffs have raised concerns about potential limitations on US beef supplies.

Today is Tuesday, July 22, 2025, and here’s your curated selection of Essential Intelligence on global markets from S&P Global. Subscribe to be notified of each new Daily Update. Energy Transition & Sustainability Understanding Energy Transition and Sustainability Reporting How are indices and data-driven insights helping market participants navigate the energy transition? S&P Dow Jones Indices’ Maya Beyhan and S&P Global Sustainable1’s Patil Mesrobian joined the CFA Institute’s Jeanette Tawk to examine the expanding toolkit for assessing energy transition risks and opportunities. Artificial Intelligence Listen: How Long the GenAI Investment Surge Will Last S&P Global Market Intelligence reporter Iuri Struta joined the “MediaTalk” podcast with host Mike Reynolds to discuss the impact of generative AI on various sectors and the investment trends driving its growth. Over $78 billion was invested in GenAI companies in the first half, a figure that nears $100 billion when third-quarter investments are included. Major players such as OpenAI and Meta are leading the charge, but a range of startups are also making waves in the application layer. Global Trade US, Australian beef prices rise amid tariff concerns for Brazilian imports US President Donald Trump’s announcement of a 50% tariff on all beef imports from Brazil has led to increased prices for 90CL lean beef trim in the US and Australia. This new tariff, effective Aug. 1, adds to the 36.4% tariff already imposed on Brazilian beef, which previously faced a 26.4% tariff before an additional 10% tariff was implemented. The escalating tariffs have raised concerns about potential limitations on US beef supplies.  Despite the current shipment period falling outside peak summer demand, beef prices have risen following the announcement. A US source indicated that while there is speculation about whether the tariffs are a bluff, the uncertainty has led to a halt in trading for all Brazilian meat, except for spot purchases. In case you missed it South Korea's second-biggest oil refiner, GS Caltex, is nearing the completion of its AGPA Refinery Complex in Indonesia. South Korea's Ministry of Agriculture, Food and Rural Affairs said it detected a case of African swine fever at a farm housing 2,500 pigs in Paju. Activity in Asian steel markets may continue to be lackluster in the July–September quarter, with participants monitoring the evolving US tariff situation and as key consuming centers enter a seasonal lull during summer and the monsoon season. Executive Edge
"Think deeper, lead better." - Impactful Leadership With Ron Malhotra

The Three Pillars of Authentic Executive Presence

Ron Malhotra
Read this article on LinkedIn to join the conversation
Read on LinkedIn

Power suits and firm handshakes don't make leaders. True executive presence runs deeper.

In boardrooms and beyond, genuine leadership presence emanates from within. It's not something you wear or memorize from a corporate etiquette handbook.

Executive presence is the blend of confidence, gravitas, and communication skills that make others believe in your ability to lead, influence, and drive results. It's not just about how you speak or carry yourself—it's about the impact you have on others and how you show up when it counts.

At Caliber International, we've identified three fundamental pillars that form the foundation of authentic executive presence: character, conduct, and class. Let's explore how to develop each one.

Pillar 1: Character

Character forms the bedrock of genuine executive presence. Without it, the other elements lack substance.

At the heart of executive presence is integrity. Leaders with strong character are authentic, transparent, and ethical in their actions. This builds trust and credibility with team members and stakeholders, which is essential for inspiring loyalty and respect.

How to develop character:

Start by defining your personal values. What principles guide your decisions? What lines would you never cross? Document these and revisit them regularly.

Practice radical accountability. Own your mistakes openly and address them promptly. Nothing builds character faster than taking responsibility when things go wrong.

Seek feedback on your blind spots. Character development requires honest self-assessment and the willingness to hear difficult truths.

...
Keep reading on LinkedIn
This email was intended for Mayank Agrawal (IESEG, Paris | HPAIR AFCON'24 | Ex ATGL | GL G'25 | VIT V'20)

json.text:
Executive Edge

By Ron Malhotra


By Ron Malhotra

    
    
    Read this article on LinkedIn to join the conversation
Read on LinkedIn
https://www.linkedin.com/comm/pulse/three-pillars-authentic-executive-presence-ron-malhotra-xou0c?lipi=urn%3Ali%3Apage%3Aemail_email_series_follow_newsletter_01%3BVqGc6sioSUyuX4jBpiXrTw%3D%3D&midToken=AQEL2poUgT6org&midSig=0amjSW8ECp0HU1&trk=eml-email_series_follow_newsletter_01-null-0-read_more_banner_cta_&trkEmail=eml-email_series_follow_newsletter_01-null-0-read_more_banner_cta_-null-9atbpc~mdod9zmw~px-null-null&eid=9atbpc-mdod9zmw-px&otpToken=MTcwMzFjZTMxNzI3YzBjN2IyMjQwNGVkNDMxZGUwYmM4Y2NjZDk0Njk4YWI4YzYxNzVjMTA2NmI0ZTVhNTRmN2YzZDNkZmJiNjBiMWRjZDU0NWFmZmRmM2Q3ZmIwMmI5MDNkNWUwMDQzY2Q5ODQ4YzA4OTNhYSwxLDE%3D
  
Power suits and firm handshakes don't make leaders. True executive presence runs deeper. In boardrooms and beyond, genuine leadership presence emanates from within. It's not something you wear or memorize from a corporate etiquette handbook. Executive presence is the blend of confidence, gravitas, and communication skills that make others believe in your ability to lead, influence, and drive results. It's not just about how you speak or carry yourself—it's about the impact you have on others and how you show up when it counts. At Caliber International, we've identified three fundamental pillars that form the foundation of authentic executive presence: character, conduct, and class. Let's explore how to develop each one. Pillar 1: Character Character forms the bedrock of genuine executive presence. Without it, the other elements lack substance. At the heart of executive presence is integrity. Leaders with strong character are authentic, transparent, and ethical in their actions. This builds trust and credibility with team members and stakeholders, which is essential for inspiring loyalty and respect. How to develop character: Start by defining your personal values. What principles guide your decisions? What lines would you never cross? Document these and revisit them regularly. Practice radical accountability. Own your mistakes openly and address them promptly. Nothing builds character faster than taking responsibility when things go wrong. Seek feedback on your blind spots. Character development requires honest self-assessment and the willingness to hear difficult truths. Remember that character isn't built in comfortable moments. It's forged through challenges and ethical dilemmas where the right choice isn't always the easy one. Pillar 2: Conduct Conduct is character in action. It's how you behave when facing pressure, conflict, or opportunity. Leaders with executive presence demonstrate consistency between their stated values and their behavior. Their actions align with their words in both public and private settings. Many people can develop a business plan when the market is favorable. But only those with great executive presence can deliver under pressure during crisis situations like recessions or pandemics. How effectively you perform in stressful circumstances reveals your true leadership presence. How to develop conduct: Establish personal operating principles that guide your day-to-day actions. These might include "I communicate directly but respectfully" or "I make decisions based on data, not politics." Practice emotional regulation. Leaders with presence remain composed under pressure. Develop techniques to manage your reactions during challenging situations. Cultivate discipline in your daily habits. As we emphasize at Caliber International, following daily processes and executing activities with discipline builds the foundation for exceptional conduct. Conduct yourself with the same standards in private as you would in public. Consistency builds trust and reinforces your character. Pillar 3: Class Class is the refined expression of character and conduct. It's the polish that makes leadership presence memorable and impactful. Recent research shows that while confidence and decisiveness remain paramount for gravitas, new weight is given to inclusiveness and respect for others. The ability to make others feel valued has become increasingly central to executive presence. Class isn't about socioeconomic status or background. It's about how you carry yourself and relate to others, especially those who can do nothing for you. How to develop class: Master the art of making others feel important. Practice genuine listening and remembering personal details about colleagues and team members. Refine your communication style. Class means speaking with precision and purpose, avoiding gossip, and communicating directly but tactfully. Develop cultural intelligence. Class in the modern business world includes understanding and respecting diverse perspectives and customs. Practice humility. True class means giving credit generously, accepting criticism gracefully, and never punching down. The Integration of All Three Pillars True executive presence emerges when character, conduct, and class work in harmony. None can compensate for weakness in the others. Strong character without class may come across as rigid. Polished class without character creates an impression of superficiality. Consistent conduct without a foundation in character lacks authenticity. The most respected leaders develop all three dimensions simultaneously. They understand that executive presence is built from the inside out, starting with core values and extending to daily behaviors and refined interactions. Practical Application Begin by assessing yourself honestly across all three pillars. Where are your strengths? Where do you need development? Select one specific aspect from each pillar to focus on over the next 30 days. Small, consistent improvements compound over time. Seek feedback from trusted colleagues on how others perceive your executive presence. The gap between intention and perception often reveals valuable growth opportunities. Remember that developing authentic executive presence is a lifelong journey. It evolves as you grow as a leader and as the business landscape changes. At Caliber International, we believe that exceptional leadership presence comes from adopting high standards of class, self-accountability, and performance. When you commit to developing these three pillars, you don't just enhance your career prospects—you elevate your capacity to influence and inspire others. True executive presence isn't just about commanding attention. It's about being worthy of it. - Ron Malhotra

🚀 Google’s FREE Certification Courses Are Changing Careers — Here’s How You Can Join

Project Management
Read this article on LinkedIn to join the conversation
Read on LinkedIn

Whether you're aiming to become a Python developer, AI specialist, or project manager, Google has opened the door — and it won’t cost you a dime.

Google is offering free certification courses that cover high-demand fields in 2025, including:

✅ Python Programming — Build the skills to code real-world applications

✅ AI Foundations — Learn how to use AI tools even without a tech background

✅ Project Management — Gain leadership and PM skills from industry pros

These are beginner-friendly programs from top instructors, and they include certificates you can proudly showcase on your LinkedIn profile..

🎓 Trusted by millions. Taught by Google.

💼 Recognized by global employers.

💵 Cost: $0 (free to enroll via audit option)

📥 Browse the list of courses and start today

No more excuses — your next career step is only a few lessons away.

The PM Newsletter

By Project Management

By Project Management

Read this article on LinkedIn to join the conversation
Read on LinkedIn
https://www.linkedin.com/comm/pulse/googles-free-certification-courses-changing-bsfxc?lipi=urn%3Ali%3Apage%3Aemail_email_series_follow_newsletter_01%3BL2fWBQs%2BReOTB9iPURBItA%3D%3D&midToken=AQEL2poUgT6org&midSig=0S_9_ZYjkx0HU1&trk=eml-email_series_follow_newsletter_01-null-0-read_more_banner_cta_&trkEmail=eml-email_series_follow_newsletter_01-null-0-read_more_banner_cta_-null-9atbpc~mdo8zo70~3c-null-null&eid=9atbpc-mdo8zo70-3c&otpToken=MTcwMzFjZTMxNzI3YzBjN2IyMjQwNGVkNDMxZGUwYjM4OWNlZDk0NDkwYWE4YTYxNzVjMTA2NmI0ZTVhNTRmN2YzZDNkZmEzNTdjMWMzZjU1ZTlmYzkwODY3YzhhMjNmYTQ0OGI0NTBjZDRlODlhNDNiYTViYywxLDE%3D

Whether you're aiming to become a Python developer, AI specialist, or project manager, Google has opened the door — and it won’t cost you a dime. Google is offering free certification courses that cover high-demand fields in 2025, including: ✅ Python Programming — Build the skills to code real-world applications ✅ AI Foundations — Learn how to use AI tools even without a tech background ✅ Project Management — Gain leadership and PM skills from industry pros These are beginner-friendly programs from top instructors, and they include certificates you can proudly showcase on your LinkedIn profile.. 🎓 Trusted by millions. Taught by Google. 💼 Recognized by global employers. 💵 Cost: $0 (free to enroll via audit option) 📥 Browse the list of courses and start today No more excuses — your next career step is only a few lessons away. #Google #FreeCourses #Python #AI #ProjectManagement #Upskill #LifelongLearning #Coursera #OnlineLearning #CareerGrowth #LinkedInLearning #DigitalSkills

A Nursing Home Manager is looking for help.

Respond to request

Nursing Home Manager

What type of resume?

Other

What stage of resume writing are you in?

I need a resume created from scratch

Where are you in your career?

Mid career

Which industries are you focused on?

Medical and health

What are your goals in seeking a resume writer? Anything else the resume writer should know? (Optional)

I am a very experienced nurse and care home manager. I have integrity, work collaboratively with others and not afraid of a challenge or to roll my sleeves up to support a team. I promote emotional intelligence which is a framework that support a strong team by actively listening to them during team building sessions which reflects in practice creating a positive culture and stress free environment. I lead by example and practice what I preach always adhering to policy and procedure, clinical governance guidelines, NMC TheCode and CQC single assessment framework. I have strong turnaround skills and can problem solve quickly using strategic thinking. I have excellent knowledge about CQC, Safeguarding, MCA/Bi, Dols, delegation according to skill mix and I am a very supporting person. I build trusting relationships with external professions, staff, residents and families. I have experience using PCS electronic systems and person centred care plans and risk assessments. I am passionate about infection prevention, health and safety, skin integrity, nutrition and hydration, medication management. I encourage staff to be open and honest when completing constructive supervisions and support them with what they are passionate about.

The Smart NRI’s Guide to Beating the U.S. Remittance Tax

It may be President Donald Trump’s “One Big Beautiful Bill”, but for 54 lakh overseas Indians in the US, the bill was proving to be one big pain.

In this edition of Cutlet, let’s look at where the “One Big Beautiful Bill” stands today, how it impacts taxpayers like Anitha, and what you could do to minimise your deductions

U.S. Remittance Tax 101

What Is It Really?

The new remittance tax applies to all money transfers sent from the United States to recipients abroad. As of July 2025, the tax brought in under the “One Big Beautiful Bill Act” was approved by the House of Representatives and is now being considered by the Senate before it can become official. The Senate version, which is not yet a law, proposes a 1% tax rate, down from the House’s 3.5% and the original 5% proposal. The bill is still subject to final negotiations and approval. It is expected to be enacted after December 31, 2025.

Anil had it right, of course! The scope of the Act has shifted tremendously during negotiations, not just on the tax rate but also on other fronts. As of today, the latest Senate draft applies to all remittance senders, not just non-citizens as was initially proposed, and it has exemptions for transfers from US bank accounts, US-issued debit/credit cards, or even via qualified remittance‑transfer providers (QRTPs). But while most NRIs were quick to spot the exemption for electronic transfers through U.S. banks and cards, not everyone understood this major exemption or benefit. Though it’s important to remember that QRTP rules are still subject to change as they are currently being drafted by the Treasury.

The Smart NRI’s Guide to Beating the U.S. Remittance Tax It may be President Donald Trump’s “One Big Beautiful Bill”, but for 54 lakh overseas Indians in the US, the bill was proving to be one big pain. In this edition of Cutlet, let’s look at where the “One Big Beautiful Bill” stands today, how it impacts taxpayers like Anitha, and what you could do to minimise your deductions U.S. Remittance Tax 101 What Is It Really? The new remittance tax applies to all money transfers sent from the United States to recipients abroad. As of July 2025, the tax brought in under the “One Big Beautiful Bill Act” was approved by the House of Representatives and is now being considered by the Senate before it can become official. The Senate version, which is not yet a law, proposes a 1% tax rate, down from the House’s 3.5% and the original 5% proposal. The bill is still subject to final negotiations and approval. It is expected to be enacted after December 31, 2025. Anil had it right, of course! The scope of the Act has shifted tremendously during negotiations, not just on the tax rate but also on other fronts. As of today, the latest Senate draft applies to all remittance senders, not just non-citizens as was initially proposed, and it has exemptions for transfers from US bank accounts, US-issued debit/credit cards, or even via qualified remittance‑transfer providers (QRTPs). But while most NRIs were quick to spot the exemption for electronic transfers through U.S. banks and cards, not everyone understood this major exemption or benefit. Though it’s important to remember that QRTP rules are still subject to change as they are currently being drafted by the Treasury. Who are QRTPs? In the context of the U.S. remittance excise tax, these are U.S. based financial institutions or service providers that are registered and regulated under U.S. federal financial laws. They offer remittance services through banking channels, but not through cash-based or informal systems. While the official IRS list is yet to come, typical bank-backed or regulated providers include: Western Union (when funded from a U.S. bank account) Wise (formerly TransferWise) Remitly, Xoom (by PayPal) Zelle, Venmo (bank-linked) Big U.S. banks (e.g., Chase, Bank of America wire transfers) Who is non-exempt: Small, unregistered money changers, informal hawala channels, and cash-based transfer shops without U.S. financial licenses. A transfer using any of the exempt providers could effectively put you out of the 1% tax bracket. No wonder NRIs, like Anil and Anitha, are finally jubilant! Before vs. After Trump What’s Different Now? So, what changes for Anita and Anil now under the One Big Beautiful Bill? At first glance, it looks like they could be paying marginally more on their monthly remittances. But there could also be more paperwork. Let’s break this down for you. How Does This Impact You? While a 1% remittance tax might not seem high, it does add up. So, for instance, if Anitha were sending her family $1,200 every month, she would now be paying $144 more every year. While this might feel insignificant, the impact gets even bigger with larger transactions. What if you suddenly needed to send your parents $100,000 for a property purchase? You would now have to provide for an additional $1,000 in tax, unless this is routed via an exempt method. If you are making your transfer through a non-exempt method, here’s an example of the calculations you would need to make to ensure the recipient receives the planned amount: Spotlight: NRE Account Transfers But how will this impact NRE accounts? This is an important question for many non-resident Indians. How an NRE account usually works A Non-Resident External (NRE) Account allows NRIs to deposit foreign earnings in India, which are fully transferable and tax-free on both principal and interest. On the other hand, a  Non-Resident Ordinary (NRO) Account is used for income earned in India, and interest is taxable. What changes? The short answer - nothing. However, it is important to understand that the U.S. tax is collected before the money leaves the United States. So, while NRE deposits remain tax-free in India, you still pay the 1 % in the U.S. when the transfer is taxable. The Fine Print The One Big Beautiful Bill Act is still a work in progress. So, you will have to watch developments on three key questions as the bill becomes a law: But these remain questions for another day. Today, for Anitha Ravi and millions of NRIs in the U.S., the remittance tax under the One Big Beautiful Bill is a new layer of complexity…but one that can be managed. With the current 1% rate and clear exemptions for bank-linked transfers and QRTPs, most routine remittances can remain low-cost or even tax-free. The key now is awareness and smart planning. As the law takes final shape, senders like Anitha have more tools and time to both reduce their tax deductions and stay compliant.

Cutlet

By Clear

By Clear

Read this article on LinkedIn to join the conversation
Read on LinkedIn
https://www.linkedin.com/comm/pulse/hidden-nri-tax-thats-hit-how-stay-safe-clearofficial-upjqe?lipi=urn%3Ali%3Apage%3Aemail_email_series_follow_newsletter_01%3BrVaZXZnZSXuePycS9qp0vw%3D%3D&midToken=AQEL2poUgT6org&midSig=2CEQ8AZL2F0rU1&trk=eml-email_series_follow_newsletter_01-null-0-read_more_banner_cta_&trkEmail=eml-email_series_follow_newsletter_01-null-0-read_more_banner_cta_-null-9atbpc~mdo4pcb5~f5-null-null&eid=9atbpc-mdo4pcb5-f5&otpToken=MTcwMzFjZTMxNzI3YzBjN2IyMjQwNGVkNDMxZGUwYjI4N2M2ZDc0ODliYTg4NzYxNzVjMTA2NmI0ZTVhNTRmN2YzZDNkZjlhNTdiMWZlZDg3YTg1ZmJiNzE4OWQ1NDFlYjE1MThjYzU2ZGRiYjJmOTY0NGY4MywxLDE%3D

The Smart NRI’s Guide to Beating the U.S. Remittance Tax It may be President Donald Trump’s “One Big Beautiful Bill”, but for 54 lakh overseas Indians in the US, the bill was proving to be one big pain. In this edition of Cutlet, let’s look at where the “One Big Beautiful Bill” stands today, how it impacts taxpayers like Anitha, and what you could do to minimise your deductions U.S. Remittance Tax 101 What Is It Really? The new remittance tax applies to all money transfers sent from the United States to recipients abroad. As of July 2025, the tax brought in under the “One Big Beautiful Bill Act” was approved by the House of Representatives and is now being considered by the Senate before it can become official. The Senate version, which is not yet a law, proposes a 1% tax rate, down from the House’s 3.5% and the original 5% proposal. The bill is still subject to final negotiations and approval. It is expected to be enacted after December 31, 2025. Anil had it right, of course! The scope of the Act has shifted tremendously during negotiations, not just on the tax rate but also on other fronts. As of today, the latest Senate draft applies to all remittance senders, not just non-citizens as was initially proposed, and it has exemptions for transfers from US bank accounts, US-issued debit/credit cards, or even via qualified remittance‑transfer providers (QRTPs). But while most NRIs were quick to spot the exemption for electronic transfers through U.S. banks and cards, not everyone understood this major exemption or benefit. Though it’s important to remember that QRTP rules are still subject to change as they are currently being drafted by the Treasury. Who are QRTPs? In the context of the U.S. remittance excise tax, these are U.S. based financial institutions or service providers that are registered and regulated under U.S. federal financial laws. They offer remittance services through banking channels, but not through cash-based or informal systems. While the official IRS list is yet to come, typical bank-backed or regulated providers include: Western Union (when funded from a U.S. bank account) Wise (formerly TransferWise) Remitly, Xoom (by PayPal) Zelle, Venmo (bank-linked) Big U.S. banks (e.g., Chase, Bank of America wire transfers) Who is non-exempt: Small, unregistered money changers, informal hawala channels, and cash-based transfer shops without U.S. financial licenses. A transfer using any of the exempt providers could effectively put you out of the 1% tax bracket. No wonder NRIs, like Anil and Anitha, are finally jubilant! Before vs. After Trump What’s Different Now? So, what changes for Anita and Anil now under the One Big Beautiful Bill? At first glance, it looks like they could be paying marginally more on their monthly remittances. But there could also be more paperwork. Let’s break this down for you. How Does This Impact You? While a 1% remittance tax might not seem high, it does add up. So, for instance, if Anitha were sending her family $1,200 every month, she would now be paying $144 more every year. While this might feel insignificant, the impact gets even bigger with larger transactions. What if you suddenly needed to send your parents $100,000 for a property purchase? You would now have to provide for an additional $1,000 in tax, unless this is routed via an exempt method. If you are making your transfer through a non-exempt method, here’s an example of the calculations you would need to make to ensure the recipient receives the planned amount: Spotlight: NRE Account Transfers But how will this impact NRE accounts? This is an important question for many non-resident Indians. How an NRE account usually works A Non-Resident External (NRE) Account allows NRIs to deposit foreign earnings in India, which are fully transferable and tax-free on both principal and interest. On the other hand, a  Non-Resident Ordinary (NRO) Account is used for income earned in India, and interest is taxable. What changes? The short answer - nothing. However, it is important to understand that the U.S. tax is collected before the money leaves the United States. So, while NRE deposits remain tax-free in India, you still pay the 1 % in the U.S. when the transfer is taxable. The Fine Print The One Big Beautiful Bill Act is still a work in progress. So, you will have to watch developments on three key questions as the bill becomes a law: But these remain questions for another day. Today, for Anitha Ravi and millions of NRIs in the U.S., the remittance tax under the One Big Beautiful Bill is a new layer of complexity…but one that can be managed. With the current 1% rate and clear exemptions for bank-linked transfers and QRTPs, most routine remittances can remain low-cost or even tax-free. The key now is awareness and smart planning. As the law takes final shape, senders like Anitha have more tools and time to both reduce their tax deductions and stay compliant.

Reliance Industries Limited is an Indian multinational conglomerate company, headquartered in Mumbai. It has diverse businesses including energy, petrochemicals, natural gas, retail, telecommunications, mass media, and textiles. Reliance Jio Careers Opportunities for Graduate Freshers, Entry Level, Mid Level and Experienced Professionals in Various domain such as Technology, Engineering, Digital, Business Operations, Customer services and many more domain Jio is an indian telecommunications company and a subsidiary of Jio Platforms, headquartered in Navi Mumbai, Maharashtra. It operates a national LTE network with coverage across all 22 telecom circles. Jio offers 5G, 4G and 4G+ services all over India and 5G service almost All Over India. Reliance Jio offers an Apprentice program designed to provide aspiring individuals with practical, hands-on experience and knowledge in various fields. This program, known as the Jio Apprentice Program, is a structured learning initiative that allows participants to work with a designated team at Jio. Apprentices gain valuable skills and build professional networks, contributing to India’s digital transformation Reliance Jio Apprentice Program Reliance Jio Careers – Explore Job Opportunities Across India Jio apprenticeship program is a fixed term structured learning initiative that provides aspiring, young, and energetic individuals with the opportunity to work and learn with a designated team at Jio and gain practical skills and knowledge in a specific trade or function. Through this immersive learning journey, apprentices acquire valuable hands-on experience and guidance, enabling them to develop the necessary expertise in their chosen field. In Addition to the technical proficiency, the apprentices learn valuable workplace skills and build professional networks, setting a solid foundation for their future careers. The program also aims to develop digital orientation and create future ready talent that would help India on its journey of Digital transformation. Overview

Phishing is a common form of cyber attack that uses emails to trick victims into providing sensitive information or installing malware. It is a major threat to businesses and individuals alike, and it is crucial to be able to detect and analyze phishing emails to prevent them from causing harm. In this blog post, we will discuss the step-by-step process of phishing email analysis to help you detect and prevent these attacks.

We can divide this analysis into two parts one would Email Body Analysis and Email Header Analysis.

Email Body Analysis

In this step, we will examine the content of the email. Look for signs that the email might be a phishing attempt, such as urgent requests for personal or financial information, requests for passwords or account numbers, or requests to download attachments, or request to click on the link. Also, pay attention to the sender's email address and the sender's domain name, as phishing emails often use fake addresses, domains that are similar to those of legitimate organizations, and sometimes use spoofed domains.
